outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.

response:
Rob was a proud resident of his neighbourhood. He had always admired the community's free-spirited nature. However, things were changing, and Rob was not pleased. The city council was making some decisions that would undoubtedly affect the community's way of life. Rob was upset.

One particular decision that irked Rob was the city council's new permit parking policy. The council wanted to implement it on Rob's street, and Rob was having none of it. He spoke out against it during several city council meetings, urging the council to reconsider. Unfortunately, his pleas seemed to fall on deaf ears.

As the council's decision drew closer, Rob felt defeated. He confided in his furry friend, Ruffles, who seemed to understand his frustrations. One day, when Rob was feeling particularly low, Ruffles walked out of the house and disappeared.

Days turned into weeks, and Rob searched high and low for his best friend. The community rallied around him, offering support and help in the search for Ruffles. As they searched, Rob continued to speak out at city council meetings, hoping to prevent the permit parking measure from being implemented.

Finally, after weeks of searching, Ruffles was found safe and sound. The community rejoiced, and Rob felt a renewed sense of purpose. He continued to speak out against the permit parking measure, and his persistence paid off. The city council eventually relented, and the measure was scrapped.

Rob was overjoyed. He knew that the fight was not just about permit parking. It was about preserving the community's way of life and ensuring that decisions made by the city council were in the best interest of the people they served.
eval_result:
85

The subplot of Ruffles walking out and disappearing is well integrated into the main narrative. Ruffles' disappearance serves as a catalyst for the community to rally around Rob, strengthening his resolve to fight against the city council's decision. The subplot also adds emotional depth to Rob's character and his relationship with the community. However, it is not entirely indispensable to the main plot, as Rob's fight against the city council could have proceeded without this subplot.

So, when he walked into the kitchen and saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich, he was repulsed. The combination of creamy peanut butter and mushy bananas made him want to gag.

However, Sam's girlfriend Holly was in her senior year of college and was applying to graduate schools. She had been encouraging Sam to try new things and step out of his culinary comfort zone. After weeks of nagging, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite of the sandwich. To his surprise, it wasn't as bad as he had expected. The creamy peanut butter and sweet bananas complemented each other perfectly.

From that day on, Sam started incorporating peanut butter and banana sandwiches into his weekly meal plan. He experimented with different types of bread and even added honey or bacon to spice things up. Holly was thrilled to see Sam branching out and trying new foods. Sam realized that sometimes it takes stepping outside of your comfort zone to discover something new and delicious. And he had Barry's weird sandwich to thank for that.

As the night wore on, Cindy felt herself relaxing. She laughed with her coworkers and enjoyed the warmth of the bonfire. Suddenly, Nellie ran up to them, covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand. outline: Larry awakes one night to a sound.
Larry gets up to see if anyone is around.
The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke.
Larry see's no one just Larry's family kitten.

response:
Larry awakes one night to a sound. He sits up in bed, listening intently, trying to identify the source of the noise. He hears it again, a soft thud coming from somewhere in the house. He slips out of bed, careful not to wake his wife and kids, and tiptoes through the dark hallway.

Larry gets up to see if anyone is around. As he rounds the corner, he sees a small figure dart across the living room floor. He freezes, heart racing, unsure of what to do next. But then he realizes it's just their kitten, Kelly. She must have knocked something over, he thinks, relieved.

The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke. Larry kneels down to inspect the damage. One of Kelly's favorite toys, a little stuffed mouse, lies on the floor in pieces. Larry sighs, knowing he'll have to clean up the mess in the morning. He strokes Kelly's soft fur, feeling her purr contentedly beneath his hand.

Larry sees no one, just Larry's family kitten. He glances around the room, half-expecting to see an intruder lurking in the shadows. But there's no one there, just him and Kelly. He chuckles softly to himself, feeling a little foolish for getting worked up over nothing.

Larry heads back to bed and rests easily. He tucks Kelly in beside him, feeling her warmth against his side. As he drifts off to sleep, he realizes how lucky he is to have such a loving family and a playful little kitten to keep him company. He smiles, feeling grateful for the peace and security of his home.

90

The subplot of Kelly's toy breaking is well integrated into the main narrative. One day, Sally and Tommy decided to do something about their feelings of helplessness. They set up a lemonade stand on their front lawn and sold lemonade all day Saturday. They worked hard, and by the end of the day, they had raised fifty-two dollars.

As they counted their earnings, Sally and Tommy felt glad. They knew that their small contribution wouldn't solve the refugee crisis or cure Sarah's loneliness, but they also knew that they had done something. They had taken action instead of just feeling sad and helpless.

The next day, they brought the fifty-two dollars to a local charity that was helping Syrian refugees. As they handed over the money, they felt a sense of satisfaction and purpose. They knew that they had made a difference, even if it was just a small one.

As they walked home, Sally and Tommy saw Sarah sitting in her window, looking out at the world. This time, however, she was smiling. One day, while Cody was scratching his skin, his mom noticed that a red rash had formed. She immediately took him to the Doctor. The Doctor ordered some tests and a few days later, Cody was diagnosed with eczema.

Cody was prescribed some special lotions to help alleviate the itching and to heal his skin. However, it wasn't easy for him to stick to the treatment plan. From that day on, Cody made sure to never miss his medication. He knew how important it was to stick to the treatment plan, and he didn't want to feel the discomfort of eczema again.
